Player 2 Then she uses Harpie's Lady Phoenix Formation to destroy his monsters. In response, Rafael uses his Guardian Shield to prevent Ceal destruction, but Backup Gardna is destroyed. 300 LP of damage. 1700 - 1200
Player 1 Rafael draws. He uses The Seal of Orichalcos. He then activates Twin Swords of Flashing Light - Tryce Ritual, equipping it to Guardian Ceal, to Ritual Summon Guardian Tryce (1900 → 2400) by discarding a card.
Player 1 Rafael uses Ceal effect by discarding a card to destroy Rose Whip. Harpie Lady (2350 → 1700).
Player 1 Guardian Tryce (2400) attacks a Harpie Lady (1700). Due to its effect, he attacks every monster named the same, meaning every single Harpie Lady. It only inflicts damage for the first one though. 700 LP damage. Every Harpie Lady is destroyed. 1700 - 500
Player 2 Mai draws. She summons a Harpie Lady Token in DEF due to Alluring Mirror Split. She uses Pot of Greed to draw 2 and sets a card.
Player 1 Rafael draws. He uses Resurrection of the Dead to bring back Backup Gardna in DEF (2200 DEF).
Player 1 His Guardian Tryce (2400) attacks the Harpie Lady Token, but Mai activates Silver Screen Mirror Wall to negate the attack and halve its original ATK (2400 → 1450). He sets a card.
Player 2 Mai draws. She summons a Harpie Lady Token in DEF due to Alluring Mirror Split, and sets a card. She summons Harpie's Pet Dragon (2000 → 2600).
Player 2 She uses Harpie's Feather Duster to destroy every Spell and Trap rafael controls. (Guardian Ceal 2600 → 2200). The Seal of Orichalcos is the only one not destroyed. Harpie's Pet Dragon (2600) attacks Guardian Ceal (2200) and is about to destroy it, but he uses Self Tribute and pays 500 LP to prevent its destruction. 400 LP damage. 800 - 500
Player 2 Rafael pays 500 LP more from the Self Tribute to equip the Bow to Ceal once again. 300 - 500
Player 1 Rafael draws. He plays Celestial Sword Eatos Ritual and then Ritual Summons Guardian Eatos (2500 → 3000). He equips her with the sword (3000 → 3300).
Player 1 He uses the effect of Guardian Ceal to discard a card and destroy the Mirror Wall.
Player 1 Eatos (3300) attacks and destroys Harpie's Pet Dragon (2600). Mai activates Amazoness Archery Squad to reduce the attack of Eatos by 500 (3300 → 2800) but is not enough. Harpie's Pet Dragon is destroyed. 200 LP damage. In the End Phase Eatos ATK returns to normal. 300 - 300
Player 2 Mai draws. She summons a Harpie Lady Token in DEF due to Alluring Mirror Split. She summons Ally-Killing Lady Knight in ATK (2000). Finally she uses Resurrection of the Dead to bring back Harpie's Pet Dragon (2000 → 2900).
Player 2 Mai attemps to use The Claw of Hermos, the last card of her hand, attempting to fuse it with Harpie's Pet Dragon but it doesn't work, as Hermos destroys itself because Mai played the Seal of Orichalcos in her previous duel. Mai is forced to return Harpie's Pet Dragon to her field. In disbelief, she passes her turn as there is nothing else she can do.
Player 1 Rafael draws. Guardian Eatos (3300) attacks and destroys Ally-Killing Lady Knight (2000). 1300 LP damage. 300 - 0
Player 1 Rafael wins. The Seal of Orichalcos surrounds Mai and takes out her soul.

EP 113 - Rafael vs The Other Yugi

Player Action LP Notes
Setup Duel in City Building (40% City, 60% Indoors) 2000 - 2000
Player 1 Rafael draws. He activates Guardian Treasure to discard 5 and draw 2. Now, while Guardian Treasure is face-up, Rafael may draw 1 extra card in his draw phase. rafael's deck: 30 → 25, 23
Player 1 He summons Backup Gardna in DEF (2200 DEF) and sets a card.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He summons Queen's Knight in face-up DEF (1600 DEF).
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. He activates Gravity Axe - Grarl, equipping it to Backup Gardna. Then, due to the axe, he ritual summons Guardian Grarl (2500) in ATK. Then he equips the Axe from Gardna to Grarl (2500 → 3000), who attacks and destroys Queen's Knight. deck: 23 → 21
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He activates Resurrection of the Dead to special summon Queen's Knight in ATK. Then he summons King's Knight, and due to its effects he summons Jack's Knight from his deck.
Player 2 He activates Brave Attack declaring Jack's Knight to attack with half of the strength of the other two (1900 + 1600/2 + 1500/2 = 3450) but Rafael activates his set Guardian Force to negate that effect and destroy Brave Attack, and end the Battle Phase.
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. He activates Butterfly Dagger - Elma, equipping it to Backup Gardna so he can summon Guardian Elma in ATK and transfer the Dagger to her, while also using the effect of Elma to equip Guardian Shield from his graveyard to her that buffs her DEF (1300/1200 → 1600/1500). deck: 21 → 19
Player 1 Grarl (3000) attacks and destroys Jack's Knight (1900). 1100 LP damage. 2000 - 900
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws, he switches his monsters to DEF.
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. Grarl attacks and destroys Queen's Knight. deck: 19 → 17
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He activates Five Star Twilight, tributing his King's Knight to summon the five kuriboh brothers: Kuriboh, Kuribah, Kuribee, Kuribeh and Kuriboo in ATK (300 each).
Player 2 He then uses the effect of Kuriboo to discard 1 card and reduce the ATK of Grarl by 1500 (as he has 5 kuri brothers so 300 ATK each is reduced).
Player 2 He then uses the effect of Kuribeh to Alter Summon Kuribabylon with all the kuriboh's attached to it, and its attack is equal to the sum of the ATK of the five kuriboh brothers (? → 1500).
Player 2 The Other Yugi uses Magic Removal to destroy the Axe. Grarl (1500 → 1000). Kuribabylon attacks Guardian Grarl but Rafael destroys Guardian Shield equipped to Elma (1500 DEF → 1200 DEF) so Grarl is not destroyed. 500 LP damage. The other yugi then sets a card. 1500 - 900
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. He sets a card and activates The Seal of Orichalcos. Grarl (2500 → 3000) attacks Kuribabylon (1500) but the other Yugi activates Attack Nullification. deck: 17 → 15
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He activates the effect of Kuribabylon to split and bring back the five Kuriboh brothers. He then uses the effect of Kuribeh to Alter Summon Kuribandit in ATK (1000).
Player 2 He then summons Dark Magician in ATK (2500), who attacks Guardian Elma, but Rafael activates his set Guardian Formation to and move Guardian Elma to the Backrow, thus negating the attack. Its secondary effect allows Rafael to activate Celestial Sword - Eatos from his deck, equipping it to Backup Gardna. deck: 15 → 14
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. He summons Guardian Eatos in ATK (2500 → 3000) and equips his Celestial Sword from Gardna to Eatos (3000 → 3300). deck: 14 → 12
Player 1 The Other Yugi activates the effect of Kuribandit to tribute itself and draw 5 cards, but discard any monster he draws (he discards 2: Gazelle, Electromagnetic Turtle).
Player 1 Rafael activates the effect of Eatos to send the sword to the graveyard, gaining 700 ATK and also gaining 100 times the amount of yugi's monsters in his graveyard. These are Gazelle, Electromagnetic Turtle, Kuribandit, Kuribah, Kuribeh, Kuribee, Kuriboh, Kuriboo, Kuribabylon, King's Knight, Jack's Knight, Queen's Knight. Eatos gains in total 700 + 1200 ATK. (3300 → 3000 → 3700 → 4900).
Player 1 Eatos (4900) attacks Dark Magician (2500), but the Other Yugi uses the effect of Electromagnetic Turtle from his graveyard to negate the battle. Eatos ATK returns to what it was (4900 → 3000).
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He summons Big Shield Gardna in face-up DEF (2600 DEF), he switches Dark Magician to DEF (2100 DEF) and sets a card.
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. Eatos (3000) attacks Dark Magician, but the Other Yugi activates his set Magical Silk Hats to create four Hat Tokens, hiding his monsters into them. Eatos attacks and destroys the hat with Big Shield Gardna. deck: 12 → 10
Player 1 He then activates Rod of Silence - Kay'est, equipping it to Backup Gardna so he summons Guardian Kay'est in ATK (1000 → 1500). He sets a card.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He activates Angel's Charity to draw three and discard two. One of the cards he drew was The Eye of Timaeus. He uses it, hoping it now works, and it does. He uses it in combination with his now revealed Dark Magician to Fusion Summon Amulet Dragon in ATK (2900).
Player 2 Due to its effect, the Other Yugi erodes 5 spell cards in his graveyard (known spells in graveyard: Resurrection of the Dead, Brave Attack, Magic Removal, Attack Nullification, Magical Silk Hat) and Amulet Dragon gains 200 ATK for each. Amulet Dragon (2900 → 3900) attacks and destroys Guardian Eatos (3000). 900 LP damage. 600 - 900
Player 2 As Guardian Eatos is destroyed, Rafael activates his set Reaper Scythe - Dreadscythe to Alter Summon Guardian Dreadscythe in its place (2500 → 3000). His effect activates, destroying Backup Gardna, Guardian Elma, Guardian Grarl, and Guardian Kay'est. As the scythe equips to it, it gains ATK for every monster in his graveyard (3000 → 4000)
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. Dreadscythe (4000) attacks and destroys Amulet Dragon (3900). 100 LP damage. 600 - 800 deck: 10 → 8
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws Treasure Cards from Heaven and activates so that both have six cards in hand. He summons Dark Magician Girl in DEF (1700 DEF) and sets a card.
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. He activates Obedience to make it so that when Dreadscythe attacks a DEF monster it is switched to ATK. deck: 8 → 6
Player 1 Dreadscythe (4000) attacks Dark Magician Girl (1700 DEF) but she is switched to attack (2000 → 2300 due to her own effect). But the other Yugi activates Magical Pigeon to negate the attack, return Dark Magician Girl to his hand and summon two Pigeon Tokens in DEF (0 DEF). Rafael sets two cards. On the End Phase, the PIgeon Tokens are destroyed and The Other Yugi Special Summons Dark Magician Girl once again in ATK (2000 → 2300).
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He activates Underworld Circle to destroy all monsters on the field, changing the terrain to graveyard. While active, players can only Special Summon a monster from their respective graveyards during each player's Main Phase 1. If a monster is destroyed it is eroded.
Player 2 The last effect of Dreadscythe activates, which forces Rafael to discard a card to revive it. The Scythe also returns, and is equipped to it. Dreadscythe doesn't allow him to summon other monsters, so he can't use the effect of Underworld Circle. The Other Yugi summons Dark Magician in ATK (2500) and sets a card.
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. The Other Yugi uses the effect of Underworld Circle to Special Summon Jack's Knight in ATK (1900). deck: 6 → 4
Player 1 Guardian Dreadscythe (4000) attacks Dark Magician, but the Other Yugi activates his set Zero Gravity to switch battle positions in the field. Rafael activates his set Spirit Hunting to switch Dreadscythe to ATK and allow it to attack and destroy all DEF Position monsters the Other Yugi controls (Dark Magician and Jack's Knight).
Player 2 The Other yugi draws. He uses the effect of Underworld Circle to Special Summon Dark Magician Girl in ATK (2000).
Player 2 He activates Altar of Restoration to remove the top two from his deck and add The Eye of Timaeus from his graveyard to his hand. Then he activates it with Dark Magician Girl and Fusion Summon Dark Magician Girl the Dragon Knight (2600) in ATK.
Player 2 Dark Magician Girl the Dragon Knight uses her Strike effect on Dreadscythe, but Dreadscythe revives itself. The Other Yugi sets a card.
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. The Other Yugi uses the effect of Underworld Circle to Special Summon Queen's Knight in ATK (1500). deck: 4 → 2
Player 1 Rafael discard Resurrection of the Dead he drew this turn to activate Orichalcos Sword of Sealing, equipping it to Dark Magician Girl the Dragon Knight and negating her effects.
Player 1 Dreadscythe (4000) attacks and destroys Dark Magician Girl the Dragon Knight (2600), which means 1400 LP of damage that would win him the duel but the Other Yugi uses his set Reduction Barrier to reduce the damage he would take by 1/10. 140 LP damage. 600 - 660
Player 2 The Other yugi draws and uses the effect of Underworld Circle to Special Summon Big Shield Gardna in DEF (2600).
Player 2 He uses Pot of Greed to draw two cards. He activates Spider Web to add the Resurrection of the Dead in Rafael's graveyard to his hand, and activate it to revive Eatos in ATK and under his control, as it wasn't attached anymore after Deathscythe was resurrected the first time.
Player 2 He activates The Claw of Hermos to fuse it with Queen's Knight and Fusion Summon Goddess Bow, equipping it to Guardian Eatos (2500 → 4000). Eatos attacks and destroys Dreadscythe.
Player 2 Dreadscythe revives itself. Since Eatos battled a monster with regeneration, the Other Yugi activates the second effect of Goddess Bow to prevent Eatos from being destroyed and allowing her to attack again.
Player 2 This loop is then repeated multiple times until it depletes Rafael's hand entirely.
Player 2 After Rafael's hand become empty, Dreadscythe is finally destroyed and eroded. Understanding his own cards and the symbolism of Eatos switching sides to destroy Dreadscythe, Rafael now knows what to do as he is virtually defeated.
Player 1 Rafael draws 2 cards due to Guardian Treasure. He uses the effect of Underworld Circle to special summon Guardian Grarl in ATK (2500 → 3000). He then activates Soul Charge to revive his guardians by emptying his graveyard, therefore special summoning Guardian Elma, Guardian Kay'est and Backup Gardna in ATK, but loses 500 LP for each monster summoned this way. 0 - 660 deck: 2 → 0. He will deck out on his next turn
Player 1 The Other Yugi wins. The Seal of Orichalcos surrounds Rafael but mysteriously it vanishes without taking his soul.

EP 115 - Dartz vs The Other Yugi + Kaiba (+Rafael +Anzu)

Player Action LP Notes
Setup Duel in Temple of Captive Souls (40% City, 60% Temple) 2000 - 2000 - 2000
Setup Battle Royale rules.
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He summons Blue-Eyes White Dragon in ATK (3000).
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He activates Chaos Ritual, tributing Devil Dragon and Holy Elf from his hand to Ritual Summon Chaos Soldier in ATK (3000). He sets a card.
Player 1 Dartz draws. He activates the Seal of Orichalcos. He summons Orichalcos Gigas in DEF (1500 DEF). Then he pays 500 LP to Special Summon Orichalcos Kyutora in ATK in his backrow (500 → 1000). 1500 - 2000 - 2000 Dartz deck: 30 → 25, 24
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He uses Fusion to Fusion Summon his Blue-Eyes White Dragon with two more in his hand, Fusion Summoning Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon in ATK (4500). He doesn't attack just yet, realizing that Gigas revives itself stronger.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He uses Fusion to fuse his Chaos Soldier and Kaiba's Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon to Fusion Summon Master of Dragon Knight (5000).
Player 2 He activates Meteorain to grant it the ability to inflict half-piercing damage It attacks and destroys Orichalcos Gigas (1500 DEF), which would inflict (5000 - 1500 = 3500 / 2 = 1750 LP) but no damage is inflicted due to Orichalcos Kyutora absorbing that damage (damage absorbed 0 + 1750 = 1750 → 3 Summoning Counters (3 total)).
Player 2 Dartz revives Orichalcos Gigas (900 → 1400).
Player 1 Dartz skips his draw due to Orichalcos Gigas, and activates Orichalcos Deuteros, attaching it to the Seal of Orichalcos. He activates its effect to regain LP for each monster he controls. He regains 500 LP. 2000 - 2000 - 2000
Player 1 Orichalcos Gigas (1400) attacks Master of Dragon Knight (5000) and it is destroyed by it. That should be 3600 selfdamage but Kyutora absorbs it, (damage absorbed 1750 + 3600 = 5350 → 7 summoning counters (10 total)). Then Dartz revives Orichalcos Gigas (1400 → 1900)
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He sets 2 cards and summons Blade Knight in ATK (1600). He has 1 card in hand so his knight gains 400 ATK (1600 → 2000).
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. Kaiba activates his set Reflect Energy to tribute his Blade Knight and allow the Other Yugi to inflict damage during the attack equal to 1/4 of the combined ATK and DEF of Dragon Master Knight (5000+4000 = 9000 / 4 = 2250), but Dartz activates the second effect of Orichalcos Deuteros to tribute his Orichalcos Gigas and return Dragon of Master Knight to the hand. However The Other Yugi activates Fusion Cancel in response, returning Chaos Soldier and Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon to their respective fields, but the attack was negated. Due to Deuteros, he cannot attack again this turn.
Player 1 Dartz draws (because his Orichalcos Gigas is no longer on the field due to tributing it). He activates Orichalcos Mirror, tributing Timeater from his hand to Ritual Summon Mirror Knight Calling in ATK (0 → 500). Deck: 24 → 23
Player 1 Due to Mirror Knight Calling, Dartz summons four Mirror Knight Tokens. The first of those attacks Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon, gaining equal ATK to it. Dartz destroys his Shield Counter so only the Blue-Eyes is destroyed.
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He sets a card. Idle warning.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. His Chaos Soldier attacks a Mirror Knight Token, but it effect also activates when attacked. Chaos Soldier is destroyed, and only one Shield Counter is destroyed.
Player 1 Dartz draws. In his standby phase he has to pay 1200 LP to keep the tokens. Then he regains all that health back with Deuteros. He uses the effect of Mirror Knight Calling to add Shield Counters to Mirror Knight Tokens that don't have Shield Counters. Deck: 23 → 22
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He activates Life-Shaving Treasure Cards to draw until he has five cards in hand. He summons Kaiser Glider in ATK (2400), who cannot be destroyed in battle with a monster with the same attack. He sets a card.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He sets a card and summons Big Shield Gardna in DEF (2600).
Player 1 Dartz draws. In his standby phase he has to pay 1200 LP to keep the tokens. Then he regains all that health back with Deuteros as he has 5 monsters on the field. Deck: 22 → 21
Player 1 Kaiba activates Raise Body Heat targeting Mirror Knight's Calling and forcing it to attack. Mirror Knight Calling (500) attacks Kaiser Glider (2400) but Kaiba uses his set Ring of Destruction to destroy it and inflict destruction damage to both of them equal to its ATK (500 LP damage to Kaiba and Dartz). 1500 - 2000 - 1500
Player 1 Destroying the Mirror Knight Calling, would also destroy the tokens, but Dartz smiles and replaces at quick speed the four tokens with four Integration Monsters of the captured souls of Pegasus, Mai, Yugi and Jonouchi. They are not longer the Token Monsters so the destruction of Mirror Knight Calling doesn't destroy them.
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He uses Pot of Greed to draw two cards. Kaiser Glider (2400) attacks Mirror Knight Mai (0 → 2400) to shake Yugi off his stupor of seeing his friends there. Kaiser Glider is not destroyed by it. Dartz destroys the Shield Counter on Jonouchi to prevent Mai's destruction. Kaiba sets a card. Shield Counters: Jonouchi 0, Mai 1, Pegasus 1, Yugi 1
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He then passes his turn as he is unwilling to attack his friends.
Player 1 Dartz draws. In his standby phase he has to pay 1200 LP to keep the knights, which leaves him at 300 LP. Then he regains all that health back with Deuteros as he has 5 monsters on the field. 2000 - 2000 - 1500 Deck: 21 → 20
Player 1 He activates his set Twin Bow Centaur, which will allow him to toss a coin to see if monsters in a single column are destroyed. He uses it in a column containing Mirror Knight Jonouchi and Kaiser Glider. He guessed right. Kaiser Glider is destroyed, Kaiba takes 600 LP damage. Jonouchi is not destroyed because Mirror Knight Yugi intercepts the attack, losing its Shield. 2000 - 2000 - 900 Shield Counters: Jonouchi 0, Mai 1, Pegasus 1, Yugi 0
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He summons Twilight Zone Dragon in DEF and passes.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He uses Magic Removal to destroy Twin Bow Centaur. He then passes his turn as he is unwilling to attack his friends.
Player 1 Dartz draws. In his standby phase he has to pay 1200 LP to keep the knights. Then he regains all that health back with Deuteros as he has 5 monsters on the field. Deck: 20 → 19
Player 1 He summons Orichalcos Malevolence in ATK (1500 → 2000). It attacks Twilight Zone Dragon and Kaiba understands that using his dimensional effect would not be enough, so he let the attack be declared and activates his set Attack Guidance Barrier to redirect the attack to Big Shield Gardna, increasing its DEF by 600 (2600 DEF → 3200 DEF). The attack fails, but Orichalcos Kyutora nullifies the 1200 battle damage that Dartz would take, (damage absorbed 5350 + 1200 = 6550 → 2 summoning counters (12 total)). Big Shield Gardna moves to ATK due to its own effect, and its DEF returns to normal.
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He changes his Twilight Zone Dragon to DEF and sets two cards.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws, he switches his Big Shield Gardna to DEF and sets a card. He then passes his turn as he is still unwilling to attack his friends.
Player 2 As he ends his turn, the Yugi Knight suddenly speaks, telling to the Pharaoh that he should not hesitate to destroy them, as he has more important things to worry about.
Player 2 Rafael joins the duel. Intrusion penalty 1000 LP. 2000 - 2000 - 900 - 1000
Player 4 Rafael draws. He uses Dimension Distortion to change one Terrain to a Different Dimension one and Special Summon Backup Gardna to it in DEF. Then, he activates Celestial Sword Eatos Ritual equipping it to Backup Gardna, which allows him to Ritual Summon Guardian Eatos to the field (2500).
Player 4 He then moves the sword to Eatos (2500 → 2800). She attacks the Mai Knight, who loses her shield counter. Eatos is destroyed. Shield Counters: Jonouchi 0, Mai 0, Pegasus 1, Yugi 0
Player 4 Suddenly, the Seal of Orichalcos surrounds Rafael and takes out his soul for the previous duel he had lost, now that he has once again regained his dark-side and anger towards Dartz. This mean he forfeits/surrenders the current duel. 2000 - 2000 - 900 - 0
Player 4 Rafael loses.
Player 1 Dartz draws. In his standby phase he has to pay 1200 LP to keep the knights. Then he regains all that health back with Deuteros as he has 5 monsters on the field. He activates Orichalcos Tritos. Deck: 19 → 18
Player 1 He uses the effect of Orichalcos Malevolence (2000) to switch Twilight Zone Dragon to ATK Position (1200) and attacks it. Kaiba activates his set Shrink to halve its attack, but Dartz activates the effect of Orichalcos Tritos to negate and destroy Shrink. The Other Yugi activates Ambush Shield, tributing Big Shield Gardna to empower the attack of Twilight Zone Dragon by half of its DEF, capped at 1000 (2600 / 3 = 1300 → 1000). Twilight Zone Dragon (1200 → 2200) destroys Orichalcos Malevolence (2000), but Dartz receives no damage due to Orichalcos Kyutora, (damage absorbed 6550 + 200 = 6750 → 0 summoning counters (12 total)). Due to Ambush Shield, Yugi sets a card.
Player 3 Kaiba draws. He activates The Fang of Critias, fusing the Other Yugi's set Mirror Force to Fusion Summon Mirror Force Dragon in ATK (2800), who attacks Mirror Knight Pegasus (500 → 2800), but its shield effect activates, preventing its own destruction. Shield Counters: Jonouchi 0, Mai 0, Pegasus 0, Yugi 0
Player 3 The effect of Mirror Force Dragon activates, destroying every monster with 1000 ATK or less that Dartz controls. Kyutora and all the Mirror Knights are destroyed, and at this point the Other Yugi and Kaiba find out that the souls of the ones trapped in the Mirror Knight were released and are now safe, although once again trapped in the stone tablets on the walls.
Player 3 As Orichalcos Kyutora was destroyed, Dartz activates Shunoros Ritual to Ritual Summon Orichalcos Shunoros, equipped with Orichalcos Dexia and Orichalcos Aristeros. Shunoros gains ATK due to the amount of damage absorbed by Kyutora represented in the 12 Summoning Counters it had (0 → 6000).
Player 3 As his monster was destroyed, Dartz activates his Martyr Curse to force Mirror Force Dragon (2800) and Shunoros (6000) to battle, and it negates the effect of Mirror Force Dragon (2800). Shunoros destroys it. 3200 LP damage. Shunoros loses 1 counter (6000 → 5500). 2000 - 2000 - 0 - 0
Player 3 As his life points drop to zero, Kaiba activates his set Wish of Final Effort to increase the Other Yugi's LP by Mirror Force Dragon's ATK (2800). Yugi gains 1400 LP. 2000 - 3400 - 0 - 0
Player 3 The Seal of Orichalcos surrounds Kaiba and takes out his soul.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He activates Pot of Greed to draw 2 cards. He summons Elf Swordsman in DEF (1200 DEF) and sets a card.
Player 1 Dartz draws. Orichalcos Shunoros (5500) attacks Elf Swordsman (1200 DEF). The Other Yugi activates Soul Shield to negate the destruction and end the battle phase, paying half his LP. Shunoros loses 1 counter (5500 → 5000). 2000 - 1700 - 0 - 0 Deck: 18 → 17
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws "Legend of Heart" and activates it. Paying 1000 LP and tributing his Elf Swordsman to special summon The Eye of Timaeus, The Fang of Critias and The Claw of Hermos from anywhere with its effects negated, and then Alter Summon with them. He summons the Knighted Alter monsters of Legendary Knight Timaeus, Legendary Knight Hermos, Legendary Knight Critias in ATK. 2000 - 700 - 0 - 0
Player 2 Due to Legend of Heart, the Seal of Orichalcos is destroyed.
Player 2 Timaeus (2800) attacks Shunoros (5000 → 4500), the attack fails but the effect of Timaeus activate (gaining Protector due to Critias effect), negating the destruction and damage and allowing Hermos to attack Shunoros (4500 → 4000), and it happens again, negating the destruction and damage and allowing Critias to attack Shunoros (4000→ 3500), the attack fails but Shunoros now has 3500 ATK.
Player 1 Dartz draws. Shunoros (3500) attacks Critias but the other Yugi activate the effect of Critias (gaining Protector due to its own effect) to activate Mirror Force in his graveyard, which reflects the attack, destroying Shunoros. Deck: 17 → 16
Player 1 As Shunoros is destroyed, Dartz activates Ritual of the Blasphemous Leviathan to Ritual Summon The Wicked Leviathan (Wicked God Ge) in ATK (infinite). Dartz LP is reduced to 0, but he cannot lose while his Wicked God is on the field. He also activates the Rule Wicked God Pantheon. Seeing that there is a Wicked God card on the field, Anzu starts acting strange. 0 - 700 - 0 - 0
Player 1 In his End Phase Dartz activates his Order to an Honorable Death to force Yugi to attack his Wicked Leviathan or he would destroy his monsters.
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. He knows he can't attack, so he sets a card and passes.
Player 2 Suddenly, Anzu joins the duel, saying that she will help him this time, and that her deck is calling her to intercede. Intrusion penalty 1000 LP. Honda, Mokuba and The Other Yugi try to stop her but she refuses. Yugi ends his turn. 0 - 700 - 0 - 0 - 1000
Player 5 Anzu draws. She activates Resurrection of the Dead to bring back Yugi's Chaos Soldier. As she returned a monster from the graveyard to the field she can Special Summon from her hand Maiden of the Moonlight. Then, she uses Angel's Lifeblood to tribute Maiden of the Moonlight and Special Summon Nuvia The Wicked Goddess from her top 6 cards, and gain 300 LP. This activates the effect of Maiden of the Moonlight, allowing her to Special Summon an Angel monster from her hand, and she chooses Friendship. 0 - 700 - 0 - 0 - 1300
Player 5 Then, she activates RItual of the Blasphemous Avatar and tribute all three monsters to Ritual Summon The Wicked Avatar, to everyone's surprise, specially to the Other Yugi.
Player 5 She tells him that she felt a connection with that card ever since the incident in the Kaiba Corporation building, and ended up recovering the card and keeping it to herself. Due to the weird things that happened back then, she became attuned to the wicked card and could hear it. Even talk to it. Yugi warns her that the card is evil, but she insists that it is not anymore, she is sure of it. And that she will use it to help him win the duel and rescue their friends together. Dartz mocks the card, saying that its power originally was drawn from The Wicked God Ge by Pegasus, and is a pale recreation of the true power of the Leviathan. Anzu had the impulse to fight after seeing Dartz summon The Wicked God Ge, and now knows why: she says that it's because the Avatar wanted to fight it itself.
Player 5 For a moment, the Wicked Avatar takes the shape of a completely black Anzu and then transforms into a black version of Geh. It attacks the Wicked God Geh, whose attack is infinity. The Wicked Avatar ATK also becomes infinity (it cannot add 1 to infinity so the attack is infinity). But it doesn't matter: defeating it would mean defeating dartz, and they have equal strength so they should kill eachother. However Wicked God Ge cannot be destroyed in battle with a Wicked God of equal or lower Hierarchy. The Wicked Avatar is destroyed, as Dartz laughs soundly. The impact of the attack knocks Anzu back.
Player 1 Dartz draws. He uses Defense Seal to change Timaeus to ATK. Wicked God Ge (infinity) attacks (Dartz mills 5 cards) and destroys Legendary Knight Timaeus (2800). The Other Yugi takes infinite LP damage so his LP goes to 0. The actual Seal of Orichalcos reappears and surrounds the other Yugi, but it breaks after revealing the fact that he hasn't lost just yet. Yugi activated his set Relay Soul, to Special Summon Dark Magician Girl in DEF (1700 DEF) and attach his life to her: if she is destroyed he will lose. 0 - 0 - 0 - 0 - 1300 Deck: 16 → 15, 10
Player 1 Dartz activates Impact Revive to special summon Legendary Knight Timaeus with an ATK increase (2800 → 3300) and allowing him to attack again. Wicked God Ge attacks Dark Magician Girl (he mills 5 cards). Deck: 10 → 5
Player 1 The Other Yugi activates Hermos effect to redirect the attack to itself (gaining Protector due to Critias effect), but then he gains the effect of Elf Swordsman so it cannot be destroyed by monsters with 1900 original ATK or higher (and given that Wicked God Geh original ATK is infinity, Hermos is not destroyed).
Player 2 The Other Yugi draws. Now that all his monsters have Protector, he uses Timaeus effect to Fusion them together into The Knight of Destiny, who copies the ATK of the strongest card on the field, becoming infinite. It (infinity) attacks Wicked God Ge (infinity). Both monsters are destroyed as they have equal stats.
Player 2 Since Dartz life was tied to Wicked God Ge, he loses the duel. Yugi still has his Dark Magician Girl, so he and Anzu agree on a shared victory.

item.title: King of Duelists Tracker
item.description:
This is a tracker for the coveted title of “King of Duelists” or “King of Games” in the Yugioh Scrolls project. It contains spoilers for important duels.

The King of Duelists is the title for the best duelist in the world, and it was originally given out by Pegasus to the champion of the Duelist Kingdom tournament but only if said winner also managed to defeat him.

👑 Current King of Duelists

Yugi
Title defenses: 0 (until ep. 140)

History


Previous Kings of Duelists

Duelist Title Defenses Lost it to… Episode
Pegasus 0 Yugi & The Other Yugi (title split in two) ep. 39
Yugi 0 Rebecca (forfeit) ep. 43
The Other Yugi 24 Rafael ep. 107
Rebecca 0 Valon ep. 109
Valon 0 Jonouchi ep. 110
Jonouchi 0 Mai ep. 110
Mai 0 Rafael (combined title) ep. 112
Rafael 1 The Other Yugi ep. 113
The Other Yugi 5 Yugi ep. 140

item.title: Pegasus' Island
item.description:
Pegasus’ Island also known as Duelist Kingdom Island is a private island owned by Pegasus J. Crawford. It is famous for hosting the Duelist Kingdom tournament and for being a base of operations for Industrial Illusions Research and Design departments. It is a remote island in the Pacific Ocean, approximately 5 km wide.

Notable Events:

  • Duelist Kingdom Tournament: Pegasus invited selected duelist from Japan to take part in the first tournament who crowned the “King of Duelists”.

Locations:

  • Castle: Pegasus main residence, situated on top of a hill.
  • Underground Caverns: the island had some underground caverns and even a maze built within.

Dueling Arenas:

  • Dueling Arena n°02: 60% Wasteland, 40% Land.
  • Dueling Arena n°10: 40% Mountain, 40% Forest, 20% Meadow. Duels: Mai vs Jonouchi.
  • Dueling Arena n°11: 40% Forest, 40% Land, 20% Lake. Duels: Mai vs Panik. Yugi vs Panik.
  • Dueling Arena n°12: 60% Land, 40% Sea. Duels: Mai vs Kajiki.
  • Dueling Arena n°13: 100% Graveyard. Duels: Kotsuzuka vs Jonouchi, Kotsuzuka vs Mai.
  • Dueling Arena n°15: 80% Forest, 20% Wasteland. Duels: Haga vs Yugi, Mai vs Anzu.
  • Dueling Arena n°16: 50% Sea, 50% Rugged Coast. Duels: Yugi vs Kajiki.
  • Dueling Arena n°33: 60% Forest, 40% Meadow. Duels: Mai vs Tournament Duelist.
  • Dueling Arena n°45: 50% Meadow, 50% Wasteland. Duels: Ryuzaki vs Jonouchi.
  • Dueling Arena n°146: 60% Land, 40% Forest. Duels: Mokuba vs Yugi, Impersonator of Death vs Yugi, Ryuzaki vs Kajiki.
  • Dueling Arena in the Castle: 100% Castle Grounds. Duels: Pegasus vs Kaiba, Mai vs Yugi, Jonouchi vs Keith, Jonouchi vs Yugi, Pegasus vs Yugi.
  • Dueling Arena in the Maze: 100% Arena. Duels: Brother Kyu + Brother Mei vs Jonouchi + Yugi, Brother Mei + Brother Kyu vs Mai + Kajiki.

Yugioh Scrolls takes place in a slightly different setting than the original anime and manga. It takes place in a single continuity so all the story chapters are interconnected and can be placed in the Timeline, and therefore there are different locations around Japan (and beyond) that are also tied to the chapters of the story, listed here.

Locations in Japan

Domino City
Pegasus' Island
Arukatorazu

Other Locations in the Human World

Egypt (WIP)
United States of America (WIP)
Atlantis (WIP)
Virtual World (WIP)

Locations in the Spirit World

Graveyard of Souls (WIP)
Dominion of the Beasts (WIP)

item.title: Timeline
item.description:
Chapters
Setting
Timeline
Duels
Characters

Yugioh Scrolls takes place in an alternative universe to the Yugioh manga or anime that we know. This is a timeline of important events in the Yugioh Scrolls project story, not a timeline of the events of the original Yugioh anime or manga. Here, events happened differently in one single big continuity that takes all story chapters into consideration.

Warning: This timeline contains spoilers for the placements of major events of Yugioh Scrolls.

Timeline

  • The Beginning of Everything
    • Horakhty creates the concept of Light.
  • ???
    • The Human world and the Spirit world come into existence together.
    • Eventually, human civilization advances beyond prehistorian times.
    • Zorc Necrophades is created out of the darkness of people’s hearts.
  • ~1000 B.C.
    • Egypt is under threat. The events leading to the massacre of Kul Elna and the creation of the Millennium Items take place.
    • The events involving Atem’s war against Thief King Bakura and Zorc Necrophades takes place. Atem is sealed in the Millennium Puzzle.
  • ~400 B.C.
    • The events involving Atlantis creation, rise and downfall take place: the orichalcos is discovered and the city develops at an incredible speed until eventually the island is destroyed by it.
  • ~1960s
    • Sugoroku Muto goes on an expedition to the Valley of the Kings and finds the Millennium Puzzle.
  • ~1970s
    • Births: Keith (12/8/70), Rishid (18/11/71), Cyndia (4/4/72), Pegasus (8/10/72) Mai (20/11/72), Ishizu (5/4/77), Noah (18/3/78), Yako Tenma (10/10/78), Gekko Tenma (10/10/78).
  • ~1980s
    • Births: Jonouchi (25/1/80), Otogi (28/2/80), Honda (19/4/80), Yugi (4/6/80), Bakura (2/9/80), Anzu (18/10/80), Seto Kaiba (25/10/80), Marik (23/12/80), Shizuka (8/4/81), Mokuba (7/7/83).
  • 1982
    • Pegasus in his youth meets Cyndia for the first time.
  • 1989
    • Cyndia passes away due to an illness shortly after her wedding with Pegasus. He starts searching the world for something to revive her.
  • 1990
    • Pegasus goes to Egypt and receives the Millennium Eye from Shadi. He starts working on Duel Monsters.
    • A young Bakura comes into contact with the Millennium Ring by following his father to the place where Shadi kept it. Bakura unleashes the power of the Millennium Ring and kills Shadi, as the kids from Prana witness the event. Shadi’s spirit would endure as a ghost.
    • Noah Kaiba dies, Gozaburo uploads his mind into a supercomputer just before his death.
    • Seto and Mokuba are sent to the orphanage and later adopted by Gozaburo.
  • 1991
    • Industrial Illusions is founded, headquartered in San Francisco (USA), and Duel Monsters is released worldwide.
    • One of the very early duels that we could see is from Ishizu and Marik as kids.
    • Marik’s father carves the symbols onto Marik’s back.
    • Pegasus adopts Gekko and Yako Tenma, eventually teaching them and a few other brilliant kids about Game Design and Duel Monsters.
  • 1992
    • On one fateful day Marik leaves the gravekeeper’s home and sees the outside world for the first time. Shadi’s ghost finds Ishizu and Marik and tells them about the incoming resurrection of the Pharaoh. The evil personality within Marik takes over and kills his father. Marik takes the Millennium Rod and leaves with Rishid the following day. Ishizu inherits the Millennium Tauk.
  • 1995
    • Pegasus goes to Egypt once again and finds the Egyptian God’s stone tablet thanks to Shadi. His team dies in mysterious circumstances briefly after returning from that trip. He ends up designing the God Cards himself but gives them to Ishizu for safekeeping.
    • At some point Marik and his Ghouls steal two of the three cards, but they are stopped by Ishizu from stealing the last one.
    • Industrial Illusions grow exponentially. By the end of the year they will have at least two personal satellites in orbit.
  • 1996
    • Yugi solves the Millennium Puzzle. Atem resurfaces.
    • From this point onward Duel Monsters become insanely popular and technology advances rapidly thanks to the Solid Vision technology, way faster than in our world. The importance of Duel Monsters skyrockets way beyond a simple game, and a huge world paradigm shift occurs.
  • March 1997 - October 1998
    • 🗝️ The events of The Millennium Chapter take place.
      • 🏰 The events of the Duelist Kingdom Arc take place.
        • The unknown Yugi defeats the champion Kaiba in an historic duel that makes waves in the Duel Monsters scene.
        • The National Japanese tournament happens, Haga is declared champion.
        • Pegasus defeats Yugi, taking his grandfather’s soul as hostage with his Millennium Eye.
        • The Duelist Kingdom tournament happens (duration 2 days). Yugi wins the tournament, defeats Pegasus and becomes Duelist King, saving his grandfather’s soul. Bakura later uses this opportunity to challenge and defeat the weakened Pegasus, taking his Millennium Eye and putting him into a coma.
      • 🏛️ The events of the Legacy Arc take place.
        • Simultaneously to the Duelist Kingdom tournament, Pegasus attempted and failed to take over Kaiba Corporation with the help of the other shareholders of that company: the group known as “the Big Five”. Kaiba ends up firing The Big Five for this betrayal.
        • Start of a new school year (2nd year of school for Yugi and friends). Otogi joins the classroom.
        • Kaiba, Yugi and friends end up imprisoned in a virtual world, in a trap set up by the Big Five and Noah Kaiba (duration 1 day).
        • “The Art of Egypt” exhibition takes place in the Domino City Museum. Shadi’s spirit tests Yugi in a duel. Ishizu meets Kaiba, gives him an Egyptian God card, and a few days later she also meets Yugi. She gives both of them knowledge about the past using the old stone tablets and her Millennium Item.
        • Bakura, Ishizu and Shadi clash at the Domino City Museum.
      • 🏙️ The events of the Battle City Arc take place.
        • The Battle City tournament happens (duration 3 days). Marik defeats Bakura and takes his Millennium Items (Ring and Eye). Ishizu gives Yugi her Millennium Tauk. Yugi later defeats Marik and takes his Millennium Items (Rod, Ring and Eye). He also now has the Egyptian God cards and the knowledge of the Pharaoh passed down through generation of Gravekeepers. Yugi now has all the Millennium Items minus the Scales and the Key.
      • 🎇 The events of the Wicked Arc take place.
        • Yako Tenma and his card professors kidnap Anzu and storm Kaiba Corporation building, luring Yugi to duel them in order to heal Pegasus from a comatose state by using Anzu’s body as a conduit. Yako wields the powerful Wicked Gods who rival the Egyptian God cards.
        • In the end they fail in their mission, but Pegasus manages to come back after all. Due to the process, Anzu develops a connection with the Wicked Gods.
        • Dartz, leader of the Doma organization, attacks Duelist Kingdom, defeats the Tenma brothers and creates “Seal of Orichalcos” cards. He then dispatch his duelists to capture souls all over the world using those cards.
        • Pegasus invites Yugi and his friends to San Francisco, USA, asking for their help. However his soul is captured by Mai before they arrive, who is working under Dartz orders. Yugi and his friends clash with the members of the Doma organization. During those battles, Yugi, Jonouchi and Kaiba enter for the first time to the Duel Monsters Spirit World in order to free the Legendary Dragons in the Domain of the Beasts.
        • Dartz wields the ultimate Wicked God card, and steals Yugi’s Egyptian God cards but thanks to the Legendary Dragons of Atlantean mythos they can fight against them. The confrontations between the two groups lead to a final battle between Yugi and Kaiba versus Dartz with the surprising assistance of Anzu using the Wicked God cards. In the end Yugi manages to deliver the final blow to Dartz, foiling his plans and recovering his Egyptian God cards.
      • 🗝️ The Events of the World of Memories Arc take place.
        • Yugi and his friends travel to Egypt to uncover the memories of the Pharaoh, meeting there with the Ishtars. Sugoroku and Fizdis also travel to Egypt but solely to find Shadi. The two of them would later become the true owners of the Ankh and Scales respectively. After defeating Shadi, Fizdis would unleash a spirit known as Anubis who holds the power of the Pyramid of Light and who judges the Pharaoh before his final trip. After proving himself and defeating him, the Pharaoh receives the last two Millennium Items (Scales and Ankh): he now has all seven items.
        • The Pharaoh and the Evil Bakura enter the world of memories and get involved in an epic duel spawning multiple sub-duels that retell and reshape the events of the past. Yugi and his friends travel to the world of memories to help him. Eventually, Kaiba also travels there, thanks to Pegasus’ help.
        • The War of the Millennium Items take place. The Pharaoh and his High Priests clash against Thief King Bakura, as the secret of the massacre of Kul Elna comes to light. Bakura manages to fulfil all conditions to revive Zorc, which was his ultimate goal. The Great Wicked God Zorc’s power is so great that even from the world of memories he’s starting to affect the real world. In the end, thanks to the help of Yugi and the others, the Pharaoh recovers his true name: Atem. With it, he summons the primordial being: Horakhty, the creator of light, who destroys Zorc once and for all.
        • After returning from the world of memories, one final task remains: the spirit of Atem has to return to the afterlife, and can only do that by being defeated in a duel. Yugi takes up that role, and in the most legendary duel of all time he manages to defeat his old partner, allowing him to rest and be free.
  • October 1998 - March 1999
    • 👑 The events of The King’s Chapter take place.
  • April 2004 - March 2007
    • 📚 The events of The Academy Chapter take place.
  • 2007 - 2009
    • Roughly in parallel, the following events happen at different points in time during these years:
    • 🔮 The events of The Signer’s Chapter take place.
    • 🔢 The events of The Numbers Chapter take place.
    • 🌌 The events of The Dimensional Chapter take place.
    • 🌐 The events of The Virtual Chapter take place.
